Module jtrim.executor
Package org.jtrim2.executor

Class FutureResultHolder<ResultType>

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.executor.FutureResultHolder<ResultType>
Type Parameters:
ResultType - the type of the result of the computation
public final class FutureResultHolder<ResultType> extends Object
Stores the result of some possibly asynchronous computation. The result of the computation can be either an error or an object.

This class can be used in situations where one thread initiates a task and needs to wait for the result of its computation. This is already possible when working with executors by waiting for their Future but maybe not otherwise. See the following simple example for usage: 


 FutureResultHolder<String> resultHolder = new FutureResultHolder<>();
 new Thread(() -> {
   resultHolder.tryStoreResult("SUCCESS");
 }).start();
 String result = resultHolder.waitResult();
 assert "SUCCESS".equals(result);
In the above code, the should always succeed unless the thread executing the code snippet is executed.

There are only two ways to signal the completion of a task:

  • Invoke the tryStoreResult(ResultType) method to signal a successful completion of the computation.
  • Invoke the trySetError(Throwable) method to signal that the computation could not be completed due to an error where the specified error describes the failure.
The first of the above calls will determine the result of the computation, subsequent signals for the completion of a task

Note that for compatibility with the JDK, instances of this class can be viewed as Future object. This Future assumes CancellationException errors to be cancellation requests and acts according to the contract of the Future interface.

Thread safety

Instances of this class are safe to be used by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Unless otherwise noted, methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

  • Constructor Details

    • FutureResultHolder

      public FutureResultHolder()
      Creates a new FutureResultHolder with no result or error set.

      To store the result of the computation invoke tryStoreResult(ResultType). To specify that the computation failed due to an exception, call the trySetError(Throwable) method.

  • Method Details

    • tryStoreResult

      public boolean tryStoreResult(ResultType result)
      Stores the result of a computation if it has not completed yet. In case the computation has already been completed either by a previous tryStoreResult(ResultType) or a trySetError(Throwable) method call, this method does nothing but returns false.

      After this method invocation the hasCompleted() method will return true and waitResult will not block but return immediately (possibly with an exception if there was a previous successful trySetError call).

      Synchronization transparency

      This method call is synchronization transparent.
      Parameters:
      result - the result of the computation. This argument is ignored and discarded if the computation has already been completed. This argument can be null.
      Returns:
      true if the specified result of the computation was stored as the result. In this case the waitResult methods will return immediately without error by returning the specified object. In case the computation has already been completed, this method returns false. Note that at most one tryStoreResult call return true for the same FutureResultHolder instance.
      See Also:
      • trySetError(Throwable)
      • waitCompletion()
      • waitCompletion(long, TimeUnit)

    • trySetError

      public boolean trySetError(Throwable error)
      Signals the the computation has failed and the failure is described by the specified exception. In case the computation has already been completed either by a previous tryStoreResult(ResultType) or a trySetError(Throwable) method call, this method does nothing but returns false.

      After this method invocation the hasCompleted() method will return true and waitResult will not block but return immediately (but maybe successfully without throwing an exception if there was a previous successful tryStoreResult call).

      Synchronization transparency

      This method call is synchronization transparent.
      Parameters:
      error - the exception describing the failure which prevented the computation from completion. In case this error is a CancellationException the future view of this FutureResultHolder is treated as canceled. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      true if this computation was marked as a failed computation where the specified exception describes the reason of the failure. In this case the waitResult methods will immediately throw an ExecutionException with the specified exception as its cause. In case the computation has already been completed, this method returns false. Note that at most one tryStoreResult call return true for the same FutureResultHolder instance.
      See Also:
      • tryStoreResult(ResultType)
      • waitCompletion()
      • waitCompletion(long, TimeUnit)

    • hasCompleted

      public boolean hasCompleted()
      Checks whether this computation has completed or not. That is, if tryStoreResult(ResultType) or trySetError(Throwable) has been called or not.

      In case this method returns true, subsequent waitCompletion methods will not block but return immediately or throw an exception. Also if this method returns true, either hasCompletedWithSuccess() or hasCompletedWithError() will return true but only one of them.

      Returns:
      true if this computation has already completed, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • hasCompletedWithError()
      • hasCompletedWithSuccess()

    • hasCompletedWithSuccess

      public boolean hasCompletedWithSuccess()
      Returns true if this computation has been successfully completed with a previous tryStoreResult method call.

      In case this method returns true, subsequent waitCompletion methods will not block but return immediately without throwing an exception. Also if this method returns true, the hasCompletedWithError() method will return false.

      Returns:
      true if this computation has already been completed successfully, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • hasCompleted()
      • hasCompletedWithError()

    • hasCompletedWithError

      public boolean hasCompletedWithError()
      Returns true if this computation has failed due to a previous trySetError(Throwable) method call.

      In case this method returns true, subsequent waitCompletion methods will not block but immediately throw an ExecutionException. Also if this method returns true, the hasCompletedWithSuccess() method will return false.

      Returns:
      true if this computation has already been completed successfully, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • hasCompleted()
      • hasCompletedWithSuccess()

    • waitResult

      public ResultType waitResult() throws ExecutionException, InterruptedException
      Waits until the computation has been completed or the current thread has been interrupted and returns the result of the computation (if not interrupted).

      This method will never block if a previous call to the hasCompleted() returned true.

      Returns:
      the result of the computation set by a previous call to tryStoreResult(ResultType). This method may return null if null was specified for the tryStoreResult method.
      Throws:
      ExecutionException - thrown if the computation has failed. The cause of the thrown exception is the exception describing the failure which can never be null.
      InterruptedException - thrown if the current thread was interrupted before the result of the computation was available. This exception is never thrown if the result is available prior th invocation of this method (i.e.: hasCompleted() returns true).
      See Also:
      • hasCompleted()
      • hasCompletedWithError()
      • hasCompletedWithSuccess()
      • tryGetResult()
      • tryStoreResult(ResultType)
      • trySetError(Throwable)

    • waitResult

      public ResultType waitResult(long timeout, TimeUnit unit) throws ExecutionException, InterruptedException
      Waits until the computation has been completed or the current thread has been interrupted or the specified timeout expires and returns the result of the computation (if the timeout did not expire and the current thread was not interrupted).

      In case the timeout expires this method will return null without throwing an exception. Note that a null value may also be returned if null was specified for a previous tryStoreResult(ResultType) method call.

      This method will never block if a previous call to the hasCompleted() returned true.

      Parameters:
      timeout - the maximum time to wait for the result of the computation in the specified time unit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
      unit - the time unit of the timeout argument. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the result of the computation set by a previous call to tryStoreResult(ResultType) or null if the timeout expires. This method may return null if the timeout expires or null was specified for the tryStoreResult method.
      Throws:
      ExecutionException - thrown if the computation has failed. The cause of the thrown exception is the exception describing the failure which can never be null.
      InterruptedException - thrown if the current thread was interrupted before the result of the computation was available. This exception is never thrown if the result is available prior th invocation of this method (i.e.: hasCompleted() returns true).
      See Also:
      • hasCompleted()
      • hasCompletedWithError()
      • hasCompletedWithSuccess()
      • tryGetResult()
      • tryStoreResult(ResultType)
      • trySetError(Throwable)

    • tryGetResult

      public ResultType tryGetResult() throws ExecutionException
      Returns the result of the computation if it is available or null if it is not. This method will never block, it will return the result if available immediately, otherwise returns null.

      In case a previous call to the hasCompleted() method returned true, this method will return the result of the computation instead of failing by returning null. Note that this method may still return null if null is the actual result of the computation.

      Returns:
      the result of the computation or null if it is not yet available. Note that null result may indicate that the tryStoreResult(ResultType) method has been successfully called with null argument.
      Throws:
      ExecutionException - thrown if the computation has been terminated with a failure. The cause of the thrown exception is the exception describing the failure which can never be null.
      See Also:
      • hasCompleted()
      • hasCompletedWithError()
      • hasCompletedWithSuccess()
      • tryStoreResult(ResultType)
      • trySetError(Throwable)

    • asFuture

      public Future<ResultType> asFuture()
      Returns this FutureResultHolder viewed as a Future. This method is provided for compatibility with the JDK.

      The returns Future is a fully functional Future whose every method is implemented according to the contract of the Future interface. The Future returned will treat failures with CancellationException as a simple cancellation. Appropriately, canceling the Future is equivalent to a trySetError(new CancellationException()) call.

      Returns:
      this FutureResultHolder viewed as a Future. This method never returns null.
